title: The trip home
name: The trip home
description:
A Map by Rnoble

On the way back to Boise, we leave the Bay area and choose a route that does not take us over Donner Pass because of the storms and snows. We head into uncharted and uninhabited lands...

properties.name: Burns - a good thing
properties.description: Posted by RnobleWe get to Burns and it is starting to get a little dark, but now we are on a slightly more major highway. Should be good to go from here. Head west now.

properties.name: Caldwell
properties.description: Posted by RnobleNow we wre really cooking. Dusk now and no snow. Only a short way to Eagle ID now.

properties.name: Eagle 12 hours later
properties.description: Posted by RnobleNot a bad trip overall. We saw some great sites and next time will snap some photos to fill in the interest. Donner did get snowed in, so the extra time we took to head on this route paid off. We made it.

properties.name: Joined back up to the 505
properties.description: Posted by RnobleCloudy and looks like storm coming in from the Pacific. We are glad we are not going over Donner. No chains means the CHP will turn you back.

properties.name: Klamath Falls
properties.description: Posted by RnoblePretty windy and cold here. Stopped at McDs - oh well, need food. This is the place fighting over water rights - environmentals, farmers and even the local tribes. Too bad a really pretty valley in the summer. Lots of migratory birds.

properties.name: Lake Albert
properties.description: Posted by RnobleI\'ll bet this is one location not seen by many! We drove between a beautiful butte and the lake and saw a total of three cars. We all waved - as if to say "what the heck are you doing here?" Not a sign of any civilization anywhere on the lake. Think area 51.

properties.name: Lakeview
properties.description: Posted by RnobleSmall and windswept. Filled up the gastank because we are heading into some pretty desolate areas. No one on the road and the sky continues to get darker.

properties.name: Nowhere
properties.description: Posted by RnobleMiles and hours of sagebrush. Hoping to see another car or ranch. None to be found. Staying ahead of the storm though. Where the heck is Burns?

properties.name: Starbucks
properties.description: Posted by RnobleI think this is where we found a Starbucks and it was great for a stop. Hobbes - our Cocker Spaniel - enjoyed the break as well.

properties.name: The turn off at Weed
properties.description: Posted by RnobleWhat can I say. Weed. Hmmm. Anyhow the storm seems to be following us, so it is good to start heading West. You circle around Mt. Shasta - which is huge and get to see it from several sides. We begin to leave civilization as we know it.

properties.name: The turn off to head north
properties.description: Posted by RnobleThis is where we turn to head north to miss the Tahoe area.
